item.title: Strategic Implications of the UAE Corporate Tax Regime
item.dc:creator: Ruairi Laughlin-Mccann
item.description: The introduction of a 9% corporate tax rate in the UAE marks a paradigm shift for freezone entities and foreign direct investment structures.
item.content:encoded:
The United Arab Emirates has historically been synonymous with tax efficiency. However, the introduction of the Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022 on the Taxation of Corporations and Businesses marks a significant maturation in the region's fiscal architecture.

For many of our clients, the primary concern lies in the status of Free Zone Persons. While the law maintains a 0% rate for "Qualifying Income," the definition of such income is rigorous.

item.title: The UK Holding Company: Stability in a Post-Brexit Landscape
item.dc:creator: Ruairi Laughlin-Mccann
item.description: Despite geopolitical shifts, the UK remains a premier jurisdiction for holding structures due to its vast treaty network and exemption regimes.
item.content:encoded:
In the wake of Brexit, global investors paused to reassess the United Kingdom's viability as a gateway to Europe. Years later, the data suggests that the UK's legal certainty and mature financial infrastructure outweigh the friction of leaving the Single Market.

The cornerstone of the UK holding company remains the Substantial Shareholding Exemption (SSE).

item.title: Operational Resilience: Beyond the Balance Sheet
item.dc:creator: Ruairi Laughlin-Mccann
item.description: Modern governance requires moving beyond financial auditing to operational resilience, ensuring continuity during systemic shocks.
item.content:encoded:
Traditional risk management often focuses heavily on financial controls and liquidity ratios. While critical, recent global events have underscored the necessity of Operational Resilience.

Effective governance now requires mapping critical business services to the underlying assets, people, technology, and third parties, that support them.
